Photograph: Christopher Thomond for the Guardian As MPs gear up for the second reading of the education bill in parliament today, the shadow education secretary " Michael Gove will ask MPs to give him more than 50 new powers to control almost every single aspect of the school system in England. The education secretary wants to tell children what subjects they should study, teachers what and how they should teach and local communities what kind of schools they must have.
